A  million scholarship fund was unanimously approved by the Texas AM University System Board of Regents on Monday June  to address diversity issues on campus as well as provide aid in the wake of COVID19 PERIOD

In a recent press release Chancellor John Sharp said this projects goal is to address accurate demographic representation across the AM University system PERIOD

According to the U.S PERIOD Census Bureau the current Texas population is . white . hispanic or Latinx . black and . asian while AM College Station reports a student body population of . white . hispanic . black and . asian PERIOD

This fund will allow for  million in scholarships each year for the next  years primarily directed to lowincome and first generation students as well as those from underrepresented population groups PERIOD

In the press release Chairman Elaine Mendoza said this decision comes at a time where many families are feeling the economic impact of the COVID19 pandemic PERIOD

Historic challenges call for historic action Mendoza said PERIOD Given the economic impact families are enduring across the state it is imperative we act now before the Fall semester begins. vice Chancellor of Marketing and Communications Laylan Copelin said the money for the  million scholarship fund will come from income produced by the Available University Fund as well as fundraising from each of the AM systems  campuses PERIOD

Copelin said this program has been in the works as called for in the Board of Regents Strategic Plan that promises the AM System will remain accessible and affordable to students regardless of socioeconomic background but was expedited due to COVID19 PERIOD

Too often we are getting outbid for great kids by outofstate schools that can make larger offers Sharp said PERIOD We dont intend to lose underrepresented students to them without a real serious fight PERIOD The goal is to make the AM System look like Texas. editorinChief
